t: Thirsting for God in Trouble and Exile.
For the choir director. A Maskil of the sons of Korah.
As*pn the deer pants for the water brooks, So*ln my soul pants for You, O God.
My*ln soul thirsts for God, for the living God; When*ln shall I come and appear before God?
My*ln tears have been my food day and night, While*ln they*i say to me all day long, “Where is your God?”

These*ln things I remember and I pour out my soul within me. For*ln I used to go along with the throng and*i lead them in procession to the house of God, With*ln the voice of joy and thanksgiving, a multitude keeping festival.
Why*ln are you in despair, O my soul? And*ln why*i have you become disturbed within me? Hope*ln in God, for I shall again praise Him For*iln the help of His presence.
O*ln my God, my soul is in despair within me; Therefore*ln I remember You from the land of the Jordan And*ln the peaks of Hermon, from Mount Mizar.
Deep*ln calls to deep at the sound of Your waterfalls; All*ln Your breakers and Your waves have rolled over me.
The*ln Lord*s will command His lovingkindness in the daytime; And*ln His song will be with me in the night, A*ln prayer to the God of my life.
I*ln will say to God my rock, “Why have You forgotten me? Why*ln do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?”
As*ln a shattering of my bones, my adversaries revile me, While*ln they say to me all day long, “Where is your God?”
Why*ln are you in despair, O my soul? And*ln why have you become disturbed within me? Hope*ln in God, for I shall yet praise Him, The*ln help of my countenance and my God.
